titlestmt.titleproper: Eleanor Este Campion genealogical research materials 1944-1994
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Eleanor Este Campion genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Eleanor Este Campion was the daughter of Harry Clifford Campion, an avid genealogist. She died on January 6, 1998.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains genealogical research materials pertaining to the Campion and related families. There are photocopies of 17th, 18th and 19th century wills for citizens of New Jersey; family names include Hall, Taylor, Newton, Plumer, Stites, and Young. There are also a number of narrative family histories, photocopies from published genealogies, and a typescript for a genealogy of the Campion family by Eleanor Este Campion's father.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
